list.title: module:Conversion
list.description: Conversion module for the UOR Math-JS library Provides utilities for converting between different number representations Supports full interoperability between standard JavaScript number types and UniversalNumber Implements the conversion utilities specified in the Prime Framework

list.title: module:Conversion~Conversion
list.description: Combine all conversion utilities into a single module

list.title: module:Conversion~Conversion.batchConvertBase
list.description: Perform batch conversion of an array of values from one base to another Uses the high-efficiency conversion pipeline

list.title: module:Conversion~Conversion.createUniversalNumber
list.description: Creates a UniversalNumber instance from the factorization This implements the core of the Prime Framework by creating universal coordinate representations

list.title: module:Conversion~Conversion.fromFactorization
list.description: Calculate the numeric value from a prime factorization

list.title: module:Conversion~Conversion.streamConvertBase
list.description: Stream conversion of values from one base to another Processes values incrementally to minimize memory usage

list.title: module:Conversion~Conversion.toFactorization
list.description: Get the prime factorization of a number with validation Ensures all factors are prime and representation is canonical per Prime Framework

list.title: module:Conversion~Conversion.transformCoordinates
list.description: Transform universal coordinates between reference frames

list.title: module:Conversion~ConversionPipelineOptions
list.description: Conversion pipeline configuration options

list.title: module:Conversion~ConversionStep
list.description: Conversion pipeline step definition

list.title: module:Conversion~DigitResult
list.description: Get the digit representation of a number in a specific base This extracts digits directly from the value

list.title: module:Conversion~ParsedJSONResult
list.description: Parses a JSON string back to number data with advanced options

list.title: module:Conversion~ReferenceFrame
list.description: Represents a reference frame in the Prime Framework A reference frame defines a specific algebraic context for universal coordinates This corresponds to a point on the smooth reference manifold M described in lib-spec.md

list.title: module:Conversion~SerializationFormat
list.description: Advanced serialization format options Provides different serialization strategies for universal coordinates

list.title: module:Conversion~baseConversionStep
list.description: Common conversion step: base conversion

list.title: module:Conversion~calculateGCD
list.description: Calculate the greatest common divisor (GCD) for fraction simplification

list.title: module:Conversion~canonicalFrame
list.description: Default canonical reference frame used for standard computations In the Prime Framework, this represents the fixed reference point x ∈ M

list.title: module:Conversion~coherenceInnerProduct
list.description: Compute the coherence inner product between two universal coordinate representations This function implements the positive-definite inner product ⟨·,·⟩c defined in the Prime Framework

list.title: module:Conversion~coherenceNorm
list.description: Compute the coherence norm of universal coordinates This implements the norm derived from the coherence inner product

list.title: module:Conversion~computeDigitsFromFactorization
list.description: Compute digits directly from prime factorization for certain bases This is faster than going through BigInt for some special cases

list.title: module:Conversion~convertBase
list.description: Convert a number from one base to another

list.title: module:Conversion~convertBaseViaUniversal
list.description: Optimized direct base conversion utility Converts a number between different bases using universal coordinates Implements efficient algorithms that leverage prime factorization properties

list.title: module:Conversion~convertBigIntToBase
list.description: Convert a BigInt to a string representation in the given base

list.title: module:Conversion~convertToUniversalStep
list.description: Common conversion step: convert to universal coordinates

list.title: module:Conversion~createConversionPipeline
list.description: Creates a conversion pipeline for processing large sets of numbers This allows efficient batch processing with minimal intermediate transformations

list.title: module:Conversion~createConversionPipeline~applyPipeline
list.description: Apply pipeline steps to a batch of items

list.title: module:Conversion~createConversionPipeline~processBatch
list.description: Processes a batch of items through the pipeline

list.title: module:Conversion~createReferenceFrame
list.description: Create a new reference frame for the Prime Framework Each reference frame corresponds to a fiber in the Prime Framework's algebraic geometry

list.title: module:Conversion~factorizationToBaseString
list.description: Convert a prime factorization to a string representation in the given base

list.title: module:Conversion~factorizationToBigInt
list.description: Convert a prime factorization to a BigInt value This is a standalone version of the method for converting a factorization to its numeric value

list.title: module:Conversion~factorizationToString
list.description: Create a string representation of a prime factorization

list.title: module:Conversion~fromBigInt
list.description: Convert a BigInt to a factorized universal representation

list.title: module:Conversion~fromNumber
list.description: Convert a JavaScript Number to a factorized universal representation Floors the number if it's not an integer, throws an error if not safe (above 2^53)

list.title: module:Conversion~fromString
list.description: Parse a string representing a number in a given base and convert to universal coordinates

list.title: module:Conversion~getCliffAlgebra
list.description: Get the Clifford algebra at this reference point In the Prime Framework, the fiber at each point is modeled as a Clifford algebra Cx

list.title: module:Conversion~getDigitCharset
list.description: Get the digit character set for a specific base Supports extended bases beyond the standard 36

list.title: module:Conversion~getDigits
list.description: Extract the digits of a number in a specific base

list.title: module:Conversion~getErrorMessage
list.description: Helper function to safely extract error message Non-recursive implementation to avoid stack overflows

list.title: module:Conversion~isCanonicalForm
list.description: Check if universal coordinates are in canonical (minimal norm) form This implements the coherence criteria from the Prime Framework specification as detailed in lib-spec.md section "Coherence Inner Product and Norm"

list.title: module:Conversion~isPrime
list.description: Determines if a given number is a valid prime This ensures the factorization contains only actual primes as required by the Prime Framework

list.title: module:Conversion~parseFactorization
list.description: Parses a string representation of a prime factorization Accepts formats like "2^3 × 3^2 × 5", "2^3 * 3^2 * 5", "22233*5", a single term like "2^4" Also handles negative representations like "-(2^3 × 3)" or "-1"

list.title: module:Conversion~toFraction
list.description: Convert a number, string, or BigInt to a fraction (numerator/denominator) This is useful for exact representation of decimal values

list.title: module:Conversion~toJSON
list.description: Serializes number data to JSON format with advanced options

list.title: module:Conversion~toScientificNotation
list.description: Convert a number to a string representation in scientific notation

list.title: module:Conversion~transform
list.description: Transform coordinates from this frame to another This implements the G-action on M that carries representations between fibers As described in lib-spec.md's section on Topological and Geometric Framework

list.title: module:Conversion~tryBaseConversionShortcut
list.description: Try optimized base conversion shortcuts for common bases Provides fast conversion paths for common base combinations like binary ↔ hexadecimal

list.title: module:Conversion~validateStringForBase
list.description: Validates if a string is a valid representation of a number in the given base

list.title: module:Factorization
list.description: Factorization module for the UOR Math-JS library Contains algorithms for converting integers into their prime factorization (universal coordinates) Enhanced with Prime Framework optimizations for performance and efficiency

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.MAX_CACHE_SIZE
list.description: Get maximum size of the cache before pruning from global config

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.PERSISTENT_CACHE_ENABLED
list.description: Check if persistent caching is enabled

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.STORAGE_KEY
list.description: Get the persistent storage key

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.cache
list.description: Map storing factorization results key: number as string, value: FactorizationResult

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.clear
list.description: Clear the cache

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.get
list.description: Get a cached factorization Implements the Prime Framework's coherence inner product by ensuring each access returns the canonical form of the factorization

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.getStats
list.description: Get comprehensive cache statistics

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.initialize
list.description: Initialize the cache, possibly loading from persistent storage

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.loadFromStorage
list.description: Load the cache from persistent storage if enabled

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.metrics
list.description: Weight metrics for each entry Used to determine which entries to keep during pruning Factors in recency of use, computational cost, and frequency key: number as string, value: {lastAccess, accessCount, computationCost}

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.prune
list.description:
Prune the cache using a sophisticated policy Prioritizes keeping entries based on a weighted formula that considers:

  • Computational cost to regenerate
  • Access frequency (popularity)
  • Recency of access
  • Completeness and confidence in the result

This aligns with the Prime Framework's efficiency requirements

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.saveToStorage
list.description: Save the cache to persistent storage if enabled Uses environment-specific storage mechanisms

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.set
list.description: Store a factorization in the cache Enforces the Prime Framework's canonical form requirement

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.setMaxSize
list.description: Set the maximum cache size

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.setPersistence
list.description: Enable or disable persistent caching

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.size
list.description: Get the current size of the cache

list.title: module:Factorization~_factorizationCache.stats
list.description: Tracks cache usage statistics

list.title: module:Factorization~ellipticCurveMethod
list.description:
Lenstra's Elliptic Curve Method (ECM) for factorization Optimized for finding medium-sized factors of large numbers Enhanced with Prime Framework optimizations for universal coordinates

This implementation uses configurable parameters for number of curves, bounds, and memory limits. All limits can be set either through the options parameter or via the global configuration system in config.factorization.ecm.

list.title: module:Factorization~factorArrayToMap
list.description: Convert array of {prime, exponent} objects to factorization map

list.title: module:Factorization~factorMapToArray
list.description: Convert factorization map to array of {prime, exponent} objects

list.title: module:Factorization~factorizationCache
list.description: Prime Framework-specific factorization optimizations and utilities Provides specialized methods for the Prime Framework

list.title: module:Factorization~factorizationCache.clear
list.description: Clear the factorization cache

list.title: module:Factorization~factorizationCache.getStats
list.description: Get statistics about the cache

list.title: module:Factorization~factorizationCache.loadFromStorage
list.description: Load the cache from persistent storage

list.title: module:Factorization~factorizationCache.saveToStorage
list.description: Save the current cache to persistent storage

list.title: module:Factorization~factorizationCache.setMaxSize
list.description: Set the maximum size of the factorization cache

list.title: module:Factorization~factorizationCache.setPersistence
list.description: Enable or disable persistent caching of factorization results

list.title: module:Factorization~factorizationCache.size
list.description: Get the current size of the factorization cache

list.title: module:Factorization~factorize
list.description: Factorize a number using trial division Implements Algorithm 1 from the specification for prime factorization

list.title: module:Factorization~factorizeOptimal
list.description: Factorize a number using the most appropriate algorithm based on its size and properties Enhanced with Prime Framework optimizations for better performance and precision Implements the Prime Framework's requirements for unique factorization and canonical form Uses configurable thresholds from config.factorization.thresholds to dynamically select the most efficient factorization algorithm based on number characteristics

list.title: module:Factorization~factorizeParallel
list.description: Implements parallel factorization using worker threads when available Falls back to sequential factorization in environments without worker thread support

list.title: module:Factorization~factorizePollardsRho
list.description: Factorize a large number using enhanced Pollard's Rho algorithm Improved with Prime Framework optimizations for performance

list.title: module:Factorization~factorizeWithPrimes
list.description: Factorize a number using optimized trial division with precomputed primes This is more efficient for moderately sized numbers

list.title: module:Factorization~findFactorsPollardRho
list.description: Recursively find factors using enhanced factorization algorithms Optimized with Prime Framework techniques for finding factors Implements a sophisticated approach that selects the most efficient algorithm for each phase of the factorization, following the Prime Framework requirements

list.title: module:Factorization~fromPrimeFactors
list.description: Create a number from its prime factorization Implements the Prime Framework's universal coordinate system conversion

list.title: module:Factorization~getErrorMessage
list.description: Helper function to safely extract error message Non-recursive implementation to avoid stack overflows

list.title: module:Factorization~getPrimeFactors
list.description: Get unique prime factors of a number (without exponents)

list.title: module:Factorization~getPrimeSignature
list.description: Find the prime signature of a number (product of (p_i - 1)(p_i^e_i - 1)) Used in various number theory contexts

list.title: module:Factorization~getRadical
list.description: Find the radical of a number (product of distinct prime factors)

list.title: module:Factorization~isFactorizationComplete
list.description: Check if the factorization of a number is complete

list.title: module:Factorization~millerRabinTest
list.description: Miller-Rabin primality test for larger numbers

list.title: module:Factorization~modularFastExp
list.description: Fast modular exponentiation for Miller-Rabin test

list.title: module:Factorization~pollardRho
list.description: Enhanced Pollard's Rho algorithm with cycle detection Optimized for the Prime Framework's factorization requirements

list.title: module:Factorization~quadraticSieve
list.description: Quadratic Sieve implementation for factoring large numbers Implements a complete and efficient factorization algorithm aligned with the Prime Framework

list.title: module:PrimeMath
list.description: PrimeMath module for the UOR Math-JS library Provides a namespace with advanced arithmetic and number theory functions Based on the Prime Framework for universal number representation

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath
list.description: The PrimeMath namespace with static arithmetic and number theory functions Aligns with the Prime Framework by leveraging prime factorization for operations

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.add
list.description: Add two numbers Uses regular addition for numeric types and coordinates-based addition for UniversalNumbers

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.areCoherent
list.description: Check if two numbers are coherent in the Prime Framework This means they represent the same abstract value despite potentially different representations

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.coherenceDistance
list.description: Compute the distance between two numbers in the Prime Framework's fiber algebra Based on the coherence inner product and norm

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.coherenceInnerProduct
list.description: Compute the coherence inner product between two numbers This measures their geometric alignment in the Prime Framework's fiber algebra

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.coherenceNorm
list.description: Compute the coherence norm of a number in the Prime Framework Measures the "magnitude" of the number in its universal representation

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.discreteLog
list.description: Calculate the discrete logarithm: find the smallest non-negative integer x such that g^x ≡ h (mod p) Uses Shanks' baby-step giant-step algorithm with efficiency improvements

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.divide
list.description: Perform exact division of one number by another Only succeeds if the division is exact (no remainder) For factorized numbers, division is performed by subtracting prime exponents

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.factorize
list.description: Factorize a number into its prime factors Provides direct access to the factorization functionality

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.fftMultiply
list.description: Perform a high-performance FFT-based multiplication of two large numbers Optimized for very large numbers beyond standard multiplication capabilities

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.fromFactors
list.description: Create a number from its prime factorization

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.gcd
list.description: Find the greatest common divisor (GCD) of two numbers For factorized numbers, GCD is computed by taking the minimum of each prime's exponents

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.getDivisors
list.description: Find all divisors of a number Uses the prime factorization to efficiently generate all divisors

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.isMersennePrime
list.description: Check if a number is a Mersenne prime (a prime of form 2^n - 1)

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.isPerfectNumber
list.description: Check if a number is a perfect number (equal to the sum of its proper divisors)

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.isPerfectPower
list.description: Check if a number is a perfect power (a^b for some integers a, b with b > 1)

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.isPrime
list.description: Check if a number is prime Uses the Miller-Rabin primality test for larger numbers For UniversalNumber, leverages the intrinsic factorization

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.jacobiSymbol
list.description: Compute the Jacobi symbol (a/n) for any integer a and positive odd integer n This is a generalization of the Legendre symbol to composite moduli

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.lcm
list.description: Find the least common multiple (LCM) of two numbers For factorized numbers, LCM is computed by taking the maximum of each prime's exponents

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.legendreSymbol
list.description: Compute the Legendre symbol (a/p) for a number and a prime modulus This determines if a is a quadratic residue modulo p

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.modInverse
list.description: Calculate the modular inverse of a number (a^-1 mod m)

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.modPow
list.description: Perform modular exponentiation (a^b mod n)

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.moebius
list.description: Calculate the Möbius function μ(n) value for a number Uses the prime factorization for efficient calculation

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.multiply
list.description: Multiply two numbers For factorized numbers, multiplication is performed by combining their prime exponent maps

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.nextPrime
list.description: Find the next prime number after a given number

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.nthPrime
list.description: Return the nth prime number Provides direct access to number theory sequences in the Prime Framework

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.optimizeToCanonicalForm
list.description: Optimize a number to its canonical form in the Prime Framework Ensures the number has minimal coherence norm for its value

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.pow
list.description: Raise a number to a power For factorized numbers, exponentiation is performed by multiplying prime exponents

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.primorial
list.description: Compute the primorial of n (the product of all primes ≤ n)

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.radical
list.description: Calculate the radical of a number (product of distinct prime factors)

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.subtract
list.description: Subtract one number from another

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.sumOfDivisors
list.description: Calculate the sum of divisors function σ(n) Uses the prime factorization for efficient calculation

list.title: module:PrimeMath~PrimeMath.totient
list.description: Calculate the Euler's totient function φ(n) - the count of numbers <= n that are coprime to n Uses the prime factorization for efficient calculation

list.title: module:UniversalNumber
list.description: UniversalNumber class for the UOR Math-JS library Represents integers using their prime factorization (universal coordinates) Implements the Prime Framework for lossless arithmetic

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~PartialFactorization
list.description: Support for partial factorization of very large numbers

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber
list.description: Create a new UniversalNumber

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#abs
list.description: Get the absolute value of this UniversalNumber

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#add
list.description: Add another number to this UniversalNumber

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#coherenceDistance
list.description: Calculate the coherence distance between this UniversalNumber and another The coherence distance measures how "far apart" two numbers are in the fiber algebra

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#coherenceNorm
list.description: Calculate the coherence norm of a UniversalNumber The coherence norm measures how consistent a number's representation is A minimal-norm representation is the canonical form in the Prime Framework

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#compareTo
list.description: Compare this UniversalNumber with another number

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#divide
list.description: Divide this UniversalNumber by another number Only succeeds if the division is exact (no remainder) For factorized numbers, division is performed by subtracting prime exponents

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#equals
list.description: Compare this UniversalNumber with another number for equality

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#formatNumber
list.description: Format the number as a string with configurable formatting options Particularly useful for very large numbers that exceed JavaScript Number limits

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#gcd
list.description: Find the greatest common divisor (GCD) of this UniversalNumber and another number For factorized numbers, GCD is computed by taking the minimum of each prime's exponents

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#getCoordinates
list.description: Get the universal coordinates (prime factorization and sign)

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#getDigits
list.description: Get the digit representation of the number in a specific base

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#getFactorization
list.description: Get the prime factorization of the UniversalNumber

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#getGradedComponents
list.description: Get this number's graded components in the fiber algebra (Clifford algebra) The graded components represent the number's digit expansions in various bases

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#getNumberParts
list.description: Get parts of the number for custom display formatting Useful for handling very large numbers that exceed JavaScript Number limits

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#isDivisibleBy
list.description: Check if this number is divisible by another

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#isIntrinsicPrime
list.description: Check if the UniversalNumber represents an intrinsic prime A number is intrinsically prime if its prime factorization consists of a single prime with exponent 1

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#isMinimalNorm
list.description: Check if this UniversalNumber is in minimal-norm canonical form In the Prime Framework, the minimal-norm representation is the unique canonical form

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#isOne
list.description: Check if this UniversalNumber is 1

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#isZero
list.description: Check if this UniversalNumber is 0

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#lcm
list.description: Find the least common multiple (LCM) of this UniversalNumber and another number For factorized numbers, LCM is computed by taking the maximum of each prime's exponents

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#mod
list.description: Compute the modulo (remainder after division)

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#modInverse
list.description: Calculate the modular inverse (a^-1 mod m) if it exists

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#modPow
list.description: Compute modular exponentiation (a^b mod n)

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#modSqrt
list.description: Calculate modular square root if it exists Finds x such that x^2 ≡ this (mod n)

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#multiply
list.description: Multiply this UniversalNumber by another number For factorized numbers, multiplication is performed by combining prime exponents

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#negate
list.description: Negate this UniversalNumber

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#pow
list.description: Raise this UniversalNumber to a power For factorized numbers, exponentiation is performed by multiplying prime exponents

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#radical
list.description: Calculate the radical of the number (product of distinct prime factors)

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#sign
list.description: Get the sign of this UniversalNumber

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#subtract
list.description: Subtract another number from this UniversalNumber

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#toApproximateNumber
list.description: Get an approximate JavaScript Number representation with scientific notation This is useful for very large numbers that exceed Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#toBigInt
list.description: Convert the UniversalNumber to a BigInt

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#toCompact
list.description: Create a compacted representation of this UniversalNumber Memory-optimized representation for very large numbers

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#toJSON
list.description: Convert the UniversalNumber to a serializable object For use with JSON.stringify

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#toNumber
list.description: Convert the UniversalNumber to a JavaScript Number

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#toString
list.description: Convert the UniversalNumber to a string representation in the given base

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#transformToFrame
list.description: Transform this UniversalNumber to a different reference frame Implements symmetry group action (G-action) on the reference manifold

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber#valueOf
list.description: Convert the UniversalNumber to a native JavaScript primitive Used for automatic conversion in expressions

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber.factorize
list.description: Factorize a number into its UniversalNumber representation with prime factorization

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber.fastMultiply
list.description: Perform fast multiplication when operands have many small prime factors Optimized for the Prime Framework's universal coordinates

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber.fromBigInt
list.description: Create a UniversalNumber from a BigInt

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber.fromCompact
list.description: Create a UniversalNumber from a compact representation

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber.fromFactors
list.description: Create a UniversalNumber from its prime factorization

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber.fromJSON
list.description: Create a UniversalNumber from a JSON representation

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber.fromNumber
list.description: Create a UniversalNumber from a regular number

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber.fromPartialFactorization
list.description: Create a UniversalNumber with partially known factorization Useful for very large numbers where complete factorization is impractical

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber.fromString
list.description: Create a UniversalNumber from a string representation

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber.fuse
list.description: Apply operation fusion to a sequence of operations This optimizes computation by eliminating intermediate results

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber.getActiveReferenceFrame
list.description: Get the currently active reference frame in the fiber algebra In the Prime Framework, numbers exist at a point on a smooth manifold M

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber.innerProduct
list.description: Calculate the coherence inner product between two UniversalNumber instances The coherence inner product is a positive-definite inner product that measures consistency between different representations of the same abstract number

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber.lazy
list.description: Create a UniversalNumber with lazy evaluation

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber.registerReferenceFrame
list.description: Register a new reference frame in the fiber algebra Used for advanced geometric interpretations of the Prime Framework

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber.setActiveReferenceFrame
list.description: Set the active reference frame for Prime Framework operations All numbers are interpreted relative to the current reference

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~UniversalNumber.verifyRoundTrip
list.description: Verify round-trip consistency between UniversalNumber and standard number formats This is used to ensure that conversions don't lose information

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~_referenceFrameRegistry.currentFrame
list.description: The currently active reference frame

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~_referenceFrameRegistry.frames
list.description: Registry of all available reference frames

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~_referenceFrameRegistry.getActiveFrame
list.description: Get the active reference frame

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~_referenceFrameRegistry.registerFrame
list.description: Register a new reference frame

list.title: module:UniversalNumber~_referenceFrameRegistry.setActiveFrame
list.description: Set the active reference frame

list.title: module:Utils
list.description: Utils module - Helper functions for the UOR Math-JS library Implements advanced mathematical utilities optimized for the Prime Framework

list.title: module:Utils~PrimeMathError
list.description: Custom error class for Prime Math-related errors

list.title: module:Utils~PrimeMathError
list.description: Create a new PrimeMathError

list.title: module:Utils~_primeCache.MAX_CACHE_SIZE
list.description: Get the maximum size of primality map before pruning from global config

list.title: module:Utils~_primeCache.initialize
list.description: Initialize the prime cache with the known primes

list.title: module:Utils~_primeCache.knownPrimes
list.description: Precalculated small primes to initialize the cache These are used as trial divisors in primality testing

list.title: module:Utils~_primeCache.largestCheckedNumber
list.description: Largest number that has been fully checked for primality

list.title: module:Utils~_primeCache.largestKnownPrime
list.description: Largest prime number currently in the cache

list.title: module:Utils~_primeCache.primalityMap
list.description: Map for storing prime status of checked numbers Uses sparse representation for memory efficiency key: number as string, value: boolean indicating primality

list.title: module:Utils~exactDivide
list.description: Perform exact division, ensuring the result is an integer Aligns with the Prime Framework's requirement for exact arithmetic

list.title: module:Utils~factorial
list.description: Factorial function Optimized for the Prime Framework

list.title: module:Utils~fastExp
list.description: Fast exponentiation algorithm (exponentiation by squaring) Efficiently computes base^exponent in O(log n) time Optimized for use in the Prime Framework Enhanced to handle large exponents safely

list.title: module:Utils~gcd
list.description: Calculate the greatest common divisor (GCD) of two numbers using the binary GCD algorithm Optimized version of the Euclidean algorithm for better performance in the Prime Framework

list.title: module:Utils~getNthPrime
list.description: Get the nth prime number Uses optimized caching and generation for efficiency

list.title: module:Utils~getPrimeRange
list.description: Get a range of prime numbers Efficiently generates primes within a specified range Uses segmented sieve of Eratosthenes for optimal performance Enhanced to respect configurable limits

list.title: module:Utils~isDivisible
list.description: Check if a number is divisible by another

list.title: module:Utils~isMersennePrime
list.description: Check if a number is a Mersenne prime (a prime of the form 2^n - 1) Mersenne primes have the form 2^p - 1 where p is also prime

list.title: module:Utils~lcm
list.description: Calculate the least common multiple (LCM) of two numbers Optimized for the Prime Framework using the GCD

list.title: module:Utils~moebiusFunction
list.description: Calculate the Möbius function μ(n) value for a number The Möbius function is defined as: μ(n) = 1 if n is square-free with an even number of prime factors -1 if n is square-free with an odd number of prime factors 0 if n has a squared prime factor

list.title: module:Utils~nextPrime
list.description: Get the next prime number after a given number Enhanced with prime cache for efficiency

list.title: module:Utils~primeCache
list.description: Export the prime cache for external use Provides access to the cache for statistics and management

list.title: module:Utils~primeCache.clear
list.description: Clear cache data for numbers above the specified threshold Retains key structural primes for efficiency

list.title: module:Utils~primeCache.getKnownPrimeCount
list.description: Get the current count of known primes in the cache

list.title: module:Utils~primeCache.getLargestKnownPrime
list.description: Get the largest known prime in the cache

list.title: module:Utils~primeCache.getMaxCacheSize
list.description: Get the maximum size limit of the prime cache

list.title: module:Utils~primeCache.getSmallPrimes
list.description: Get a copy of the known small primes list

list.title: module:Utils~primeCache.getStats
list.description: Get detailed statistics about the prime cache

list.title: module:Utils~primeCache.setMaxCacheSize
list.description: Set the maximum size of the prime cache Enhanced to provide fine-grained control over memory usage

list.title: module:Utils~primeGenerator
list.description: Get a prime number generator/iterator that produces sequential primes Follows the Prime Framework's stream-based approach

list.title: module:Utils~quadraticResidue
list.description: Check if a is a quadratic residue modulo p A number a is a quadratic residue modulo p if there exists an x such that x^2 ≡ a (mod p)

list.title: module:Utils~toBigInt
list.description: Safely convert a value to BigInt Enhanced to handle a wider range of inputs for the Prime Framework

list.title: module:config
list.description: Configuration system for the math-js library Central storage and management of all configurable settings and limits

list.title: module:config~configure
list.description: Update configuration with custom settings

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig
list.description: Default configuration for the library Contains all settings and their default values

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.async
list.description: Controls behavior of asynchronous operations

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.async.defaultTimeout
list.description: Default timeout for async operations in milliseconds (0 = no timeout)

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.async.maxWorkers
list.description: Maximum number of concurrent workers for parallel operations

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.async.reportProgress
list.description: Whether to report progress events for long-running operations

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.async.useWorkers
list.description: Whether to use WebWorkers when available

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.cache
list.description: Controls caching behavior for computational results

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.cache.enabled
list.description: Whether to enable caching of computational results

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.cache.evictionPolicy
list.description: Eviction policy for cache ("lru", "fifo", "random")

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.cache.maxFactorizationCacheSize
list.description: Maximum number of entries in the factorization cache

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.cache.maxPrimeCacheSize
list.description: Maximum number of entries in the prime number cache

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.cache.maxSize
list.description: Maximum size of the cache in bytes (approximate)

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.cache.persistentCache
list.description: Whether to use persistent caching (if available in the environment)

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.cache.ttl
list.description: Time-to-live for cache entries in milliseconds (0 = no expiry)

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.conversion
list.description: Controls number conversion behavior

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.conversion.cacheResults
list.description: Whether to cache conversion results

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.conversion.defaultBase
list.description: Default base for number conversion operations (when not specified)

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.conversion.directConversionLimit
list.description: Maximum size (in digits) for direct conversion without chunking

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.conversion.maxBase
list.description: Maximum allowable base for conversions

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.conversion.minBase
list.description: Minimum allowable base for conversions

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.errorHandling
list.description: Controls error handling and reporting

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.errorHandling.includeStackTrace
list.description: Whether to include stack traces in errors

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.errorHandling.strictMode
list.description: Whether to throw on potentially recoverable errors

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.errorHandling.verbosity
list.description: Level of detail in error messages ("minimal", "standard", "verbose")

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization
list.description: Controls factorization behavior

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.algorithm
list.description: Algorithm to use for factorization ("auto", "trial", "pollard", "quadratic", etc.)

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.completeSizeLimit
list.description: Maximum size (in digits) for which to attempt complete factorization

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.ecm
list.description: Elliptic Curve Method (ECM) specific settings

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.ecm.b1ScaleFactor
list.description: Base factor for scaling B1 parameter based on input size B1 is multiplied by this factor raised to a power based on number size

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.ecm.defaultB1
list.description: Default B1 bound for stage 1 of ECM Larger values can find larger factors

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.ecm.defaultB2
list.description: Default B2 bound for stage 2 of ECM (0 = auto-calculate as B1 * 100) Larger values can find larger factors

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.ecm.defaultMemory
list.description: Default memory (in MB) for ECM stage 2 when no limit is specified

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.ecm.maxCurves
list.description: Default maximum number of curves to try in ECM Higher values increase chance of finding factors but take longer

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.ecm.maxMemory
list.description: Maximum memory (in MB) to use for ECM stage 2 Higher values improve performance but increase memory usage 0 = no specific limit (use system available memory)

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.lazy
list.description: Whether to compute factorization lazily

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.maxIterations
list.description: Maximum number of iterations for probabilistic factorization algorithms

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.memoryLimit
list.description: Memory limit (in MB) for factorization operations (0 = no limit)

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.thresholds
list.description: Thresholds for factorization method selection based on number size (digits) Controls when to switch between different factorization algorithms

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.thresholds.ecm
list.description: Maximum digit size for using Elliptic Curve Method (ECM) Numbers up to this size will use ECM

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.thresholds.optimizedTrialDivision
list.description: Maximum digit size for using optimized trial division with precomputed primes Numbers up to this size will use trial division with cached primes

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.thresholds.pollardRho
list.description: Maximum digit size for using Pollard's Rho algorithm Numbers up to this size will use Pollard's Rho

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.thresholds.quadraticSieve
list.description: Maximum digit size for using Quadratic Sieve Numbers up to this size will use Quadratic Sieve for factorization

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.thresholds.trialDivision
list.description: Maximum digit size for using simple trial division Numbers up to this size will use basic trial division

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.factorization.timeLimit
list.description: Maximum time (in milliseconds) to spend on a factorization attempt (0 = no limit)

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.memory
list.description: Controls memory usage and optimization

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.memory.gcStrategy
list.description: Garbage collection strategy ("auto", "aggressive", "conservative")

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.memory.maxMemoryUsage
list.description: Maximum memory usage limit in MB (0 = no explicit limit)

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.memory.optimizeMemory
list.description: Whether to optimize memory usage at the expense of performance

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.memory.useCompactRepresentation
list.description: Whether to use compact representations for storage

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.performanceProfile
list.description:
Performance profile for the library

  • "balanced": Default profile balancing speed and precision
  • "speed": Optimize for speed with potential precision trade-offs
  • "precision": Maximum precision regardless of performance impact

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.primalityTesting
list.description: Controls primality testing behavior

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.primalityTesting.basicSieveChunkSize
list.description: Size of each chunk for the basic sieve when handling large ranges Controls memory usage vs. performance tradeoff

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.primalityTesting.deterministicTestLimit
list.description: Maximum size (in digits) for deterministic primality testing Larger numbers will use probabilistic tests

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.primalityTesting.dynamicSegmentSizing
list.description: Whether to dynamically adjust segment size based on range size and available system resources

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.primalityTesting.maxPrimesGenerated
list.description: Maximum number of primes to generate in a single operation Acts as a safety limit to prevent memory exhaustion

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.primalityTesting.millerRabinRounds
list.description: Number of Miller-Rabin rounds for primality testing Higher values give more confidence for large numbers

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.primalityTesting.segmentedSieveSize
list.description: Size of each segment for the segmented sieve of Eratosthenes algorithm Controls memory usage vs. performance tradeoff

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.primalityTesting.useTrialDivision
list.description: Whether to use trial division before advanced primality tests

list.title: module:config~defaultConfig.primalityTesting.verificationThreshold
list.description: Threshold for using different primality testing algorithms Numbers below this threshold use simple primality test Numbers above this threshold use Miller-Rabin test

list.title: module:config~getConfig
list.description: Get the current configuration

list.title: module:config~resetConfig
list.description: Reset configuration to default values

list.title: module:dynamicLoader
list.description: Dynamic module loader for the Prime Framework Enables selective loading of modules for performance optimization

list.title: module:dynamicLoader~clearCache
list.description: Clear the module cache

list.title: module:dynamicLoader~getRegisteredModules
list.description: Get list of all registered modules

list.title: module:dynamicLoader~isLoaded
list.description: Check if a module is loaded

list.title: module:dynamicLoader~loadModule
list.description: Load a module (and its dependencies) dynamically

list.title: module:dynamicLoader~registerModule
list.description: Register a module with the dynamic loader

list.title: module:math-js
list.description: UOR Math-JS Library A JavaScript implementation of the Prime Framework for universal number representation

list.title: module:math-js.analysis.product
list.description: Calculate the product of an array of numbers

list.title: module:math-js.analysis.sequence
list.description: Create a sequence of numbers

list.title: module:math-js.analysis.sum
list.description: Calculate the sum of an array of numbers

list.title: module:math-js.crypto.modInverse
list.description: Modular multiplicative inverse (a^-1 mod n)

list.title: module:math-js.crypto.modPow
list.description: Modular exponentiation (a^b mod n)

list.title: module:math-js.crypto.randomPrime
list.description: Generate a random prime number of specified bit length

list.title: module:math-js.numberTheory.factorize
list.description: Get the prime factorization of a number

list.title: module:math-js.numberTheory.gcd
list.description: Calculate the greatest common divisor of two numbers

list.title: module:math-js.numberTheory.isPrime
list.description: Check if a number is prime

list.title: module:math-js.numberTheory.lcm
list.description: Calculate the least common multiple of two numbers

list.title: module:math-js.numberTheory.nextPrime
list.description: Find the next prime number after a given value

list.title: module:math-js~configure
list.description: Update configuration with custom settings

list.title: module:math-js~createAsync
list.description: Creates an asynchronous processor for expensive operations

list.title: module:math-js~createStream
list.description: Creates a stream processor for handling sequences of UniversalNumbers

list.title: module:math-js~createStream~stream.filter
list.description: Filter values in the stream

list.title: module:math-js~createStream~stream.map
list.description: Map each value in the stream using a transform function

list.title: module:math-js~createStream~stream.pipe
list.description: Pipe the output of this stream to another transformer

list.title: module:math-js~createStream~stream.process
list.description: Process a sequence of values

list.title: module:math-js~createStream~stream.reduce
list.description: Reduce a sequence of values to a single result

list.title: module:math-js~getPlugin
list.description: Get a registered plugin by name

list.title: module:math-js~registerPlugin
list.description: Register a plugin with the library
